page.title: 06FARMING IN EGLOSKERRY (1)
page.content: As we live in a very rural area we tried to visit all the farms in the twelve kilometre squares and collect information from the farmers. In all we visited seventeen farms. Most of the farmers bought and sold animals at Launceston market. Other markets that were used by some of the farmers were Hallworthy, Holsworthy and Week St. Mary. Only one farmer sold his animals directly to a slaughter house and not through the market system. The biggest farm is called the Tregeare Estate and has 624 acres.The smallest farm is Tresanber with 5 acres. The average farm size is 171 acres. The total acreage of all the farms we visited amounted to 2941 acres.
